prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Sketching the Base for the Rectangular Prism Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. Draw the sketch as follows: * Draw a rectangle using the following line segments: 1. Start Point: [0.0, 0.0], End Point: [0.218, 0.0] 2. Start Point: [0.218, 0.0], End Point: [0.218, 0.0454] 3. Start Point: [0.218, 0.0454], End Point: [0.0, 0.0454] 4. Start Point: [0.0, 0.0454], End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop to complete the sketch. The sketch should appear as a rectangular shape with one side open. Creating the 3D Model by Extruding the Sketch Now, extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards the normal (Z-direction): 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite to the normal (-Z-direction): 0.75 * Sketch scale factor: 0.218 Adding a Cylindrical Hole to the Rectangular Prism At the center of the rectangle on the top surface, create a cylindrical hole with these parameters: * Cylinder Diameter: 0.0654 (approximately one-third of the width) * Extrusion depth: 0.218 (same as the width of the sketched rectangle) * Position: at the center of the top surface of the rectangular prism, 0.109 above the XY plane. This completes the construction of the first part of the assembly. The resulting CAD model should be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole through its center, positioned at an angle with the cylindrical hole facing towards the viewer. Part dimensions: * Length: 0.218 m * Width: 0.75 m (height of the prism) * Height: 0.218 m (height of the prism)</description>
